['**Body Mass Index (BMI):** A BMI of 18.5 or lower can indicate malnutrition, which may lead to feeling left hungry.', '**Weight:** Weighing less than 154 lbs (69 kg) for an adult male or 130 lbs (59 kg) for an adult female can suggest undernourishment.', '**Muscle Mass:** Reduced muscle mass can be a result of inadequate nutrition, leading to feelings of hunger.', '**Food Insecurity:** Limited access to affordable and nutritious food can lead to frequent feelings of hunger.', '**Mental Health:** Stress, anxiety, or depression can increase appetite and make it harder to feel satisfied, leaving individuals feeling left hungry.', '**Sleep Patterns:** Insufficient sleep can disrupt hunger hormones, leading to increased hunger and cravings.', '**Food Availability:** Limited access to healthy food options or irregular meal times can contribute to feelings of hunger.', '**Social Circumstances:** Poverty, homelessness, or refugee status can all increase the risk of food insecurity and left-hunger feelings.', '**Climate Change:** Weather-related events, such as droughts or floods, can impact food availability and lead to hunger.', '**Weakened Immune System:** Malnutrition can impair immune function, making individuals more susceptible to illnesses.', '**Fatigue:** Chronic hunger can cause fatigue, affecting daily functioning and overall well-being.', '**Increased Risk of Diseases:** Left hungry for extended periods can increase the risk of chronic diseases like diabetes, hypertension, or cardiovascular disease.']
['Availability - On tap, Abundant, Easily obtainable, etc.', 'Hunger and Food Insecurity - Left Hungry, Unfed, Malnourished, etc.', 'Convenience and Accessibility - At-hand, Handy, Convenient, etc.']
